content.description: Approach up the chute right of Lost in Wonderland (class 3-4).The route is on the east face of an obvious brown varnished block at the top of the chute.  It climbs an overhanging dihedral with a tips crack.  A short route, but excellent varnish.
content.protection: A hand size piece to start, then thin wires and TCUs up to finger size.

content.description:
You'll find this short south-facing hand crack left of

Night Trap (aka The Sound of Waves)

.

A bouldery start (5.9) gives way to moderate (5.7) hand jamming with the occasional wide section. Gear belay and rap off using the anchors atop Night Trap.

Only worth doing as a warm-up for the more difficult lines nearby, as a trip here solely for this route would be somewhat of a disappointment. The climbing is enjoyable but nothing special, which earns it one star out of five.

climbs.name: Night Trap (aka The Sound of Waves)
climbs.fa: (TR) Paul Schweizer & Randy Leavitt, 1986  FL: Steve Sutton, Chris Miller, Karen Roseme & Bill Russell

content.description:
Left of

Wavecrest

on the southeast arete of the Wavecrest Block is this high quality sport route.

Steep pulling on positive holds lead up to a distinct crux around the fourth bolt after which easier moves lead to bolted anchor/rap.

Great rock and enjoyable moves are to be found on this remote and seldom done sport route which is guarded by a stiff ninety minute approach. Three stars out of five.
